description: Fundamental concepts in computer science including algorithms, data structures, and programming paradigms. Hands-on projects and problem-solving exercises.
Advanced study of data structures (lists, trees, graphs), algorithm design, and computational complexity. Implementation in Python and C++.
Introduction to AI techniques: search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning basics, natural language processing.
Limits, derivatives, integrals of single-variable functions. Applications to optimization and physics problems.
Vector spaces, matrices, eigenvalues, linear transformations, applications to systems and data analysis.
Cell structure and function, genetics, evolution, ecology. Lab component includes microscopy and organism observations.
Atomic structure, bonding, stoichiometry, thermodynamics. Lab includes safety training and practical experiments.
Academic writing skills, essay structure, research methods, citation formats, peer review and revision.
Survey of major civilizations and events from prehistory through the Middle Ages. Emphasis on cultural and political development.
Foundations of psychology including perception, memory, learning, personality, social behavior, and mental health.
